block.p: Robyn Michele Dunn, a daughter of Paula Carr Centers of Lindstrom, Minn., and Stephen M. Dunn of Rancho Santa Fe, Calif., was married yesterday to Andrew Allen Schwarz, a son of Patricia and Roy Schwarz of Hyde Park, Vt. The Rev. Wendy Manley, an Episcopal priest and an aunt of the bridegroom, officiated at the Presidio Chapel in Santa Barbara, Calif.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a cataloger and researcher of Impressionist and Modern art at Sotheby's in New York. She graduated from the University of California at Santa Barbara and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at Baruch College. Her father is the president of the Romar Company, a commercial real estate company in Rancho Santa Fe.

Robyn Michele Dunn, a daughter of Paula Carr Centers of Lindstrom, Minn., and Stephen M. Dunn of Rancho Santa Fe, Calif., was married yesterday to Andrew Allen Schwarz, a son of Patricia and Roy Schwarz of Hyde Park, Vt. The Rev. Wendy Manley, an Episcopal priest and an aunt of the bridegroom, officiated at the Presidio Chapel in Santa Barbara, Calif.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a cataloger and researcher of Impressionist and Modern art at Sotheby's in New York. She graduated from the University of California at Santa Barbara and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at Baruch College. Her father is the president of the Romar Company, a commercial real estate company in Rancho Santa Fe.

The bridegroom, 34, is a vice president for acquisitions and asset management at Emmes & Company, a real estate investment company in New York. He graduated from American University and received an M.B.A. degree from Columbia. His father owned Schwarz & Associates, a commercial and industrial real estate company that was in New Orleans; he is now the chairman of Copley Hospital in Morrisville, Vt.
